project_objective: Implementation of a self-contained macOS application packaging BCML with all dependencies in an isolated runtime environment to maintain source integrity of the original BCML codebase.

error_handling.description: Always handle errors and use appropriate exit codes to ensure robust script execution.

shebang.description: All executable shell scripts must start with #!/bin/bash for consistency.

path_traversal.description: Avoid path traversal vulnerabilities by validating file paths before use.

input_validation.description: Validate all user inputs to prevent unexpected behavior or security issues.

environment_variables.description: Always quote environment variable expansions to prevent word splitting and globbing.

file_permissions.description: Set appropriate file permissions: 755 for executables and 644 for non-executables.

no_binary_files.description: Avoid committing binary files to the repository, with exceptions for necessary assets.

required_directories.description: Maintain a consistent project structure with required directories.

original_bcml_files.description: Do not modify 'bcml' project files that originated from the original BCML repository.
